name: Interactive State Completeness
description: When a component defines interactive states for a token (e.g., hover, active, focus), all expected states should be defined together. Incomplete state sets lead to inconsistent interaction feedback.
rule: If a component token defines a hover state (e.g., --dsa-button_primary--color_hover), it should also define the base interactive state and the active state. Missing states create gaps in the interaction model.

color-states.description: Color-related properties should define both hover and active states for complete interaction feedback

shadow-states.description: Box-shadow typically only needs a hover state for elevation change

exceptions: Tertiary/ghost buttons may intentionally omit background-color base state (transparent by default)
Read-only or display-only elements don't need interactive states
Some properties (font-size, padding, border-radius) typically don't change on interaction
